issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [X] Browser version is up-to-date; - [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard Browser Extension ### AdGuard version other ### What type of problem have you encountered? Website or app doesn't work properly ### Which browser(s) do you use? other (specify in comment below) ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? https://apptics.zoho.com ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy AdGuard Tracking Protection filter ### Social Widgets _No response_ ### Annoyances _No response_ ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific _No response_ ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. 2. Screenshots
Screenshot 1:
Screenshot N: ### Privacy - [X] I agree to follow this condition

issue.title: google.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.google.com/intl/ja_jp/chromebook/discover/?authuser=0](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2Fintl%2Fja_jp%2Fchromebook%2Fdiscover%2F%3Fauthuser%3D0) ### Comment > The slide to select a Chromebook product line does not work properly when the AdGuard Cookie Notices filter is enabled. > It will stop working after one scroll to either side. > Adding a rule for when AdGuard is off to the user rules now makes the slide work correctly. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://www.google.com/search?q=AI+Overview&sca_esv=ad3cebe3ffb4734a&source=hp&ei=thXEZs7dI8GmkPIP05Gk6A8&oq=AI+Overview&gs_lp=EhFtb2JpbGUtZ3dzLXdpei1ocCILQUkgT3ZlcnZpZXcyCxAAGIAEGLEDGIMBMggQABiABBixAzIFEAAYgAQyBRAAGIAEMgUQABiABDIFEAAYgAQyBRAAGIAEMgUQABiABEjmMFD9E1jWLHACeACQAQCYAXagAdMGqgEDOS4yuAEDyAEA-AEBmAINoAKiCKgCD8ICChAAGAMY6gIYjwHCAgoQLhgDGOoCGI8BwgIREC4YgAQYsQMY0QMYgwEYxwHCAgsQLhiABBjRAxjHAcICDhAuGIAEGLEDGIMBGIoFwgIPELkBGIAEGLEDGIMBGO8EwgILEC4YgAQYsQMYgwHCAggQLhiABBjlBJgDBZIHAzkuNKAHhEI&sclient=mobile-gws-wiz-hp](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2Fsearch%3Fq%3DAI%2BOverview%26sca_esv%3Dad3cebe3ffb4734a%26source%3Dhp%26ei%3DthXEZs7dI8GmkPIP05Gk6A8%26oq%3DAI%2BOverview%26gs_lp%3DEhFtb2JpbGUtZ3dzLXdpei1ocCILQUkgT3ZlcnZpZXcyCxAAGIAEGLEDGIMBMggQABiABBixAzIFEAAYgAQyBRAAGIAEMgUQABiABDIFEAAYgAQyBRAAGIAEMgUQABiABEjmMFD9E1jWLHACeACQAQCYAXagAdMGqgEDOS4yuAEDyAEA-AEBmAINoAKiCKgCD8ICChAAGAMY6gIYjwHCAgoQLhgDGOoCGI8BwgIREC4YgAQYsQMY0QMYgwEYxwHCAgsQLhiABBjRAxjHAcICDhAuGIAEGLEDGIMBGIoFwgIPELkBGIAEGLEDGIMBGO8EwgILEC4YgAQYsQMYgwHCAggQLhiABBjlBJgDBZIHAzkuNKAHhEI%26sclient%3Dmobile-gws-wiz-hp) ### Comment > Last week, Google’s AI Overview started appearing in my search results. It doesn’t appear on every search, but I find it highly annoying when it does. I’ve tried utilizing user rules to block it via cosmetic filtering (alongside other annoyances such as “People also ask”, People also search for”, and “Get the answer you’re looking for added to the web”), but I haven’t had any success with user rules on iOS. The element picker doesn’t seem to be able to pull the correct CSS elements and rules posted in forums such as r/uBlockOrigin have no effect. Username: `@N/A` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/semuzr8o98g4s4c0oo8wswkso04kk4krkxlpft82qo.jpg?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/2efi45n03l348c8k4c4skks0gk0scs8mtsyrpgkayo.jpg?nc=1)
Screenshot 3 ![Screenshot 3](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/oz2r0tqeonkc8gg4os8swgkc0sgc8kg1xzzm69pool.jpg?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.5 System version: | iOS, 17.6.1 License type: | paid Advanced protection: | enabled DNS filtering: | server: `https://dns.cloudflare.com/dns-query`
